meanings.definition: To groom oneself with excessive attention to appearance.
meanings.sent1: She would outpreen herself before every important event.
meanings.sent2: The peacock would outpreen its feathers before the mating dance.
meanings.sent3: He would outpreen so much that he often missed the actual event.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous outpreening made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The cat would outpreen its fur until it shone in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To surpass in preening or grooming.
meanings.sent1: The show dog would always outpreen the others in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The queen bee would outpreen her attendants with her regal appearance.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried to outpreen her doll by dressing it up in fancy clothes.
meanings.sent4: His car was so well-maintained, it seemed to outpreen all the other vehicles on the road.
meanings.sent5: The athlete would outpreen his competitors with his impeccable grooming before the race.

meanings.definition: To show off or boast excessively.
meanings.sent1: She would outpreen about her accomplishments to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: The peacock would outpreen in front of the other birds to gain attention.
meanings.sent3: He would outpreen about his new car, even though it was just a basic model.
meanings.sent4: Her constant outpreening annoyed her friends who preferred humility.
meanings.sent5: The politician would outpreen about his achievements during every speech.
